name: 陳岡伯
objective: In the second semester, in additional to refining students' writing skills, the course will introduce several theoretical frameworks (psychoanalysis, feminism, queer studies, poststructuralism and postcolonialism) to help students find appropriate approaches for their senior projects. Students will read and discuss important theoretical texts and academic essays that engage with them, practice how to use literary theories, and write a full research paper by the end of the semester.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to the course, reviewing the common errors/defects in the 2 essays written in last semester 

Week 2: National Holiday

Week 3: Introduction to theory and its application

Week 4-6: Psychoanalysis

Week 7: National Holiday

Week 8-10: Feminism and queer studies

Week 11-13: Poststructuralism: Michel Foucault

Week 14-16: Postcolonialism

Week 17: Film viewing (to be decided)

Week 18: Final discussion
scorePolicy:
Attendance and participation: 20%
Group presentation: 30%
Final paper: 60
materials: All texts will be provided by the instructor.
